channel.title: Crystal
channel.description:
Crystal is a programming language that is extremely similar to Ruby (it's pretty much the same thing), EXCEPT that it compiles to native code.
Website: http://crystal-lang.org/
Github: https://github.com/manastech/crystal
[ul][li]Ruby-inspired syntax.[/li] [li]Never have to specify the type of a variable or method argument.[/li] [li]Be able to call C code by writing bindings to it in Crystal.[/li] [li]Have compile-time evaluation and generation of code, to avoid boilerplate code.[/li] [li]Compile to efficient native code.[/li][/ul]
This looks very promising and I'm quite excited about it's outcome. I always love to see new languages that aren't ran on top of a VM, especially one that resembles ruby so much.
Did I mention that the Crystal compiler is written in Crystal? Ya, it's [i]that[/i] cool.
GF rust :-)

item.title: Crystal
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Mopman:

I don’t really understand why they wouldn’t just write a Ruby native compiler, rather than a new language with a ‘Ruby inspired’ syntax.

Because everybody and their dog wants to create their own language these days. Now we’ve got this stupid situation where there are lots of half-baked languages that are extremely niched with maybe a half dozen cool features each - but a lot left to be desired.

Read full topic

item.title: Crystal
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

WOWE, just like your post? Imagine how that works! But by basis of inference based upon: Your username, your reputation, and your comment I made a very educated guess you have near to 0 or a single level, of 100, experience with Rust besides calling it syntactically ‘better’. But we can compare the languages, one based on syntactically sugary syntax, and one that takes roots in performance and “being memory safe without using garbage collection” and just take a side note that the third from this submission is just a shit post.

https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=6975740

Here’s a pretty good thread with qualified* people sharing their opinions about Rust and other languages syntactically.

*Don’t trust the interwebs

Read full topic
